description: Starting on March 20, 2020, teachers in Kyrgyzstan will work remotely until April 8. In educational institutions, shifts will be organized to prepare 11th grade students for ORT. School and preschool institutions in Kyrgyzstan will not work until April 8, the press service of the Ministry of Education and Science said. This decision was made in order to combat the spread of the coronavirus. Teachers will work with students remotely. Despite the announced quarantine, shifts are being organized in educational institutions to prepare 11th grade students for nationwide testing.

description: Starting on 25 March, a curfew will be imposed from 20:00 to 07:00 in Kyrgyzstan. At this time, the movement of citizens and vehicles will be prohibited. Guests of the capital and territories where the state of emergency is introduced must leave before 00:00. It was announced by the Deputy Minister of Internal Affairs Orozaliev Almazbek.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Starting on 25 March, a curfew will be imposed from 20:00 to 07:00 in Kyrgyzstan. At this time, the movement of citizens and vehicles will be prohibited. Guests of the capital and territories where the state of emergency is introduced must leave before 00:00. It was announced by the Deputy Minister of Internal Affairs Orozaliev Almazbek. 
UPD: The commandant of Bishkek issued an order for a curfew until May 11. Mobile brigades have been created in the capital, which will work with entrepreneurs and taxi drivers. The commandant of Bishkek, Almaz Orozaliev, signed an order on the operation of a curfew in the city until May 11, the press center of the commandant's office said. The order was signed on May 1. The curfew time has not changed - from 21:00 to 6:00.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Starting on 25 March, a curfew will be imposed from 20:00 to 07:00 in Kyrgyzstan. At this time, the movement of citizens and vehicles will be prohibited. Guests of the capital and territories where the state of emergency is introduced must leave before 00:00. It was announced by the Deputy Minister of Internal Affairs Orozaliev Almazbek. 
UPD: Curfew and pass system in Bishkek will remain until May 10 - Boronov. In three cities and one region of the country, the state of emergency is extended. Restrictions within the framework of the regime will remain the same. The curfew and the pass system will operate in emergency zones until May 10, despite some relaxation of the regime, First Deputy Prime Minister Kubatbek Boronov said. According to him, if travel is allowed without passes, there will be a risk of the spread of coronavirus and loss of control over the situation.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Starting on 25 March, a curfew will be imposed from 20:00 to 07:00 in Kyrgyzstan. At this time, the movement of citizens and vehicles will be prohibited. Guests of the capital and territories where the state of emergency is introduced must leave before 00:00. It was announced by the Deputy Minister of Internal Affairs Orozaliev Almazbek. 
UPD: On May 10, Curfew is canceled in Bishkek and parts of Kyrgyzstan. The period of the state of emergency expires in the Kyrgyz Republic this night. The headquarters decided to cancel the curfew. In Bishkek, Osh and Jalal-Abad, the curfew imposed on March 25 as part of the declared state of emergency is canceled, the press service of the Kyrgyz government said.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Kyrgyzstan "a state of emergency was introduced in Bishkek, Osh, Jalal-Abad cities, Nookat and Kara-Suu regions of Osh Oblast and Suzak region of Jalal-Abad Oblast on March 25."

"Kyrgyzstan declares a state of emergency in the cities of Bishkek, Osh and Jalal-Abad, as well as Nookat and Kara-Suu districts of Osh region, and in Suzak district of Jalal-Abad region," from March 25 to April 15.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
In Kyrgyzstan "a state of emergency was introduced in Bishkek, Osh, Jalal-Abad cities, Nookat and Kara-Suu regions of Osh Oblast and Suzak region of Jalal-Abad Oblast on March 25." 
The state of emergency has been extended till April 30.

On April 3 in Kyrgyzstan, "an unintentional violation of sanitary and epidemiological regulations, which creates a threat of mass infection and poisoning of people in the period of the emergency situation, the state of emergency, or martial law, is punishable with imprisonment of 2.5 to 5 years." Additionally, "a violation of the emergency situation regulations is punishable with a fine of 20,000 to 30,000 soms (from $243 to $365) or freedom restriction for three to six months. A violation of the requirements imposed by the state of emergency or martial law is punishable with a fine of 30,000 to 60,000 soms (from $365 to $731) or freedom restriction for six to 12 months."
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On Feb 28, it was announced that crossing the border of Kyrgyzstan with an ID-card is temporarily prohibited. Some citizens tried to cross the border with an ID card, hiding the fact of arriving in Moscow from countries with an unfavorable epidemiological situation. Kyrgyz citizens were temporarily banned from crossing the state border with ID-cards. This decision was made by the republican headquarters for the prevention of coronavirus, the press service of the government reported. Passports of Kyrgyz citizens returning to their homeland are checked. The temporary ban is introduced from March 1. It is associated with the strengthening of border controls due to the spread of the coronavirus COVID-19. As noted at the headquarters, attempts of Kyrgyzstanis to cross the border with an ID card were revealed, hiding the fact of arriving in Moscow from countries with an unfavorable epidemiological situation. All these citizens have been quarantined. This temporary measure is introduced from March 1, 2020, to clarify which country the citizen came from.
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On February 18th 2020, upon arrival in the country, citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic must present a passport, and in case of its absence, pass a questionnaire and a medical examination. Kyrgyz citizens returning to the country are checked their civil (foreign) passports to find out if they have visited China in the past three months, the press service of the State Border Service of the Kyrgyz Republic reports. It is noted that there is strict control of citizens along the entire perimeter of the border, especially those who have visited countries with an unfavorable epidemiological situation. It is about preventing the spread of the coronavirus. "Citizens crossing the state border go through passport control through the" electronic gate "(e-gate) system using biometric passports. After that, they must present a foreign passport to check whether they have visited the PRC for the last three months. In the absence of a passport, the citizen passes questioning and additional examination ", - the message says. The ministry recalls that, according to the algorithm of actions prepared by the Ministry of Health, all citizens arriving in Kyrgyzstan undergo thermometry and laboratory testing of sputum samples from the upper respiratory tract. "Citizens who have visited countries with an unfavorable epidemiological situation are thoroughly checked and sent to observational facilities for quarantine and a comprehensive examination," the State Border Service said.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 25 in Kyrgyzstan, Pensioners can take a PCR test for coronavirus for free, Minister of Health Sabirzhan Abdikarimov said at a briefing. Earlier it was revealed that one network of private laboratories, together with state medical institutions, will begin testing for COVID-19. The minister was asked if anyone could count on a free analysis. According to him, the laboratory has already begun work. Up to 3.5 thousand people will be able to pass free tests. "Pensioners and some other interested persons will be analyzed free of charge. Later we will fix the list of categories by order," Abdikarimov said.

Kyrgyz volunteers launch an online platform aimed at helping healthcare professionals combating COVID-19 to assess their needs in protective equipment, as well as to evaluate readiness of medical institutions to treat COVID-19.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On May 8, it was announced that a laboratory for the study of tests for coronavirus was opening in Talas (Kyrgyzstan). A laboratory is opening in the Talas region today, where tests for coronavirus will be tested, Deputy Health Minister Nurbolot Usenbaev said. According to him, virological studies will begin tomorrow. "Previously, all studies took place in Bishkek. Now all citizens and freight carriers crossing the border with Kazakhstan through the Chon-Kapka checkpoint will be checked on the spot in the region," Usenbaev said. There are 9 laboratories in the country, where up to 2,000 PCR tests are carried out daily, the deputy minister added.

On June 22, the Ak-Keme Hotel in Bishkek is planned to be turned into a hospital (Kyrgyzstan). Health Minister Sabirzhan Abdikarimov was asked at a briefing why not a single mobile hospital was built in Kyrgyzstan amid the pandemic. "The hospital, albeit not mobile, was built on the site of the former base named after Gansi. There are all conditions. There is a water supply system, a shower and a toilet. The hospital has five buildings with 120 beds, 600 in total. In addition, seven more buildings have been prepared for observation of visitors Unfortunately, each room does not have a bathroom, but there is a common one. If necessary, we plan to turn the Ak-Keme hotel into a hospital, "the minister replied.

On July 14, the Intensive Care Unit will begin accepting patients. Currently, six two-store buildings are undergoing major repairs. In the observation of "Semetey" on the territory of the former airbase "Gansi", intensive care wards for 400 places will be opened, the press service of the Kyrgyz government reported. In the observation of "Semetey" on the territory of the former airbase "Gansi", intensive care wards for 400 places will be opened, the press service of the Kyrgyz government reported. These places will be created for the treatment and dynamic monitoring of seriously ill patients. Six two-store buildings, which are on the balance sheet of the State Defense Committee, are now undergoing major repairs. "Since a large number of patients with COVID-19 and pneumonia are observed in Bishkek and the Chui region, it was decided to promptly open additional beds. Everything necessary for quality treatment and work of medical personnel will be taken into account," Boronov said.
Intensive care wards will start accepting patients tomorrow. Now the observation will have 1,700 beds, taking into account the new 400.

On 28 July, it was announced that new hospitals will open in seven regions of Kyrgyzstan. In Bishkek and Osh, hospitals are being built from pre-fabricated structures. In other regions, vacant buildings are being converted into medical institutions. New hospitals will appear in seven regions of Kyrgyzstan, Prime Minister Kubatbek Boronov said at a briefing. According to him, the construction of hospitals has begun in Bishkek and Osh, and some buildings in the regions will also be converted into medical institutions. Bishkek: Construction of an infectious diseases hospital for 100 beds has begun. It will be located on the territory of the Republican Clinical Infectious Diseases Hospital, and it will be built from pre-fabricated structures. Osh: Since July 25, a hospital for 100 beds from pre-fabricated structures is being built on the territory of the infectious diseases hospital. It is planned to open it in September. Kara-Suu district of Osh region: in the village of Bash-Bulak, the renovation of an object redesigned as a hospital has begun. Suzak district of Jalal-Abad region: In the village of Lenin, the five-story building of specialized lyceum No. 36 will be redesigned as a hospital for 304 beds. The work will be completed in September. Batken: The building of the old hospital will be converted into a hospital for 90 beds. Chui Region: In the village of Dmitrievka, the building of a boarding school will be renovated to accommodate a hospital for 100 beds.

description: On Mar 18, The head of Suzak (Kyrgyzstan) said that an emergency regime is being introduced in the region and then quarantine will be enforced. Akim of Suzak region Ermekbay Omoshev made an appeal to residents of the region and Jalal-Abad region after the detection of coronavirus in the region. According to him, an emergency regime has been introduced in the area, then quarantine will be announced. "There is no reason for panic. Follow the recommendations of the Ministry of Health, observe hygiene. There is enough food in the region. I urge everyone to act within the law," the akim said.

Starting on March 20, in Kyrgyzstan, markets are closed in Jalal-Abad, public transport will not work, clothing markets will be closed for a three-week quarantine, and route traffic will stop indefinitely. In the city of Jalal-Abad, all markets are closed and public transport stops, the press service of the mayor's office reported. According to the press service, in order to prevent the spread of coronavirus, catering points - cafes, restaurants, fast food outlets - will also be closed. "Also, the clothing markets of Shabdaly Bazar, Nooruz and Madumar Ata will be closed for a three-week quarantine. Route traffic in the city has been suspended for an indefinite period," the mayor's office explained.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: Starting on Mar 26, several streets of Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan) will be closed - quarantine zone map created. Not everyone will be allowed to enter quarantine zones. The quarantine zone is created in order to disinfect the city. Only certain people will be allowed into the zone. A quarantine zone has been created in Bishkek closer to the city center, Bishkek commandant Almaz Orozaliev said at a press conference. According to him, the zone is limited to 7 April, Akhunbaev, Bakaeva streets, Molodaya Gvardii, Zhibek Zholu, Saliev and Osmonkul avenues. "A ban will be introduced for pedestrians and cars, because disinfection is being carried out in the zone. Only civil servants, doctors, law enforcement officers, the banking system and representatives of companies providing the city with food and medicine will be allowed in," he said.

Starting on Apr 3, In Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan), checkpoints will appear at supermarkets and markets. The authorities remind that residents of the city can leave their homes during the day only to a pharmacy, a medical facility or to buy essential products. The quarantine zone in Bishkek will expand, the Republican Headquarters for Combating Coronavirus said. Taking into account the fact that the incubation period will end in the next two days in persons who have come into contact with the infected, they will restrict movement in additional areas of the city, the headquarters noted. "Sanitary and quarantine posts will be set up near markets and supermarkets in order to restrict traffic and to avoid crowds of people and vehicles. You can go to the pharmacy and buy groceries if necessary. You must have a passport and route sheet, also do not forget to wear a mask and handle your hands. antiseptic, "the message says.

Starting on July 1, restrictions are being introduced in Bishkek. Transport will run only at certain hours and a ban will be imposed on the activities of nightclubs and "toykanas". In addition, the opening hours of shops and bazaars are being reduced, which the mayor also said in a text broadcast.

description: On April 6, "The Ministry of Health of Kyrgyzstan established a Scientific Advisory Expert Council (SAEC),." description: Starting at Jan 10, Kyrgyzstan, at border points with China, tightened medical control so as not to miss a new type of pneumonia, Abdykadyr Zhoroev, head of the epidemiological department of the Department of Disease Prevention and State Sanitary and Epidemiological Surveillance of the Ministry of Health, said that they receive information from the Chinese side through the World Health Organization. According to him, control has been strengthened at the checkpoints on the border with China: Torugart and Irkeshtam, as well as at the Manas airport, as flights from Urumqi arrive daily. In particular, Kyrgyz doctors use thermal imagers. "If there are first signs, including fever, that is, an increase in temperature, then thermal imagers will" catch "them. If a patient is identified, he will be isolated and treated in medical institutions. To date, no such patients have been identified," Zhoroev said. He noted that not only citizens of Kyrgyzstan, but also of China are checked at sanitary control points. That is, even if the patient is able to cross the border when contacting doctors with primary signs (fever and shortness of breath), the latter will immediately inform the Ministry of Health about him. Moreover, it does not matter whether patients will apply to private or state clinics, doctors are obliged to warn the department.

Starting on Jan 26, the government of Kyrgyzstan has strengthened security measures at airports, at the borders; it is planned to create checkpoints on the border with Kazakhstan. Thermal imagers have been installed at all border checkpoints of Kyrgyzstan, as well as at the airports of Bishkek and Osh, to check those entering for the presence of coronavirus, the government press service said. Specialists of the sanitary and quarantine point (SQP) check with thermal imagers all persons arriving in Kyrgyzstan from China and third countries. 11 sanitary and quarantine points operate around the clock. They are installed on the borders with China, Tajikistan, and Uzbekistan. Now the issue of creating sanitary and quarantine points on the internal borders of the EAEU (Kyrgyzstan - Kazakhstan) is being resolved since with the entry into the EAEU such points were disbanded. Starting next week, temporary sanitary and quarantine posts will start working at the Akzhol, Dunlarov Bridge, Aktilek, and Chaldovar checkpoints. Round-the-clock control over flights from other countries is organized. Doctors carry out thermometry at the exit from the aircraft. Four portable thermal imagers are operational, the isolator is prepared.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: Starting on Jan 27, the government of the Kyrgyz Republic is working to clarify the list of students who study in China. If necessary, the issue of their evacuation will be resolved. Six Kyrgyz students arrived in the Kyrgyz Republic from Urumqi (China), they were placed in the special wards (isolation ward) of the Republican Infectious Diseases Hospital, the government press service reports, citing Health Minister Kosmosbek Cholponbaev.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: 18 Kyrgyz citizens were evacuated from the Chinese city of Wuhan, where the coronavirus outbreak occurred, Deputy Minister of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic Tolo Isakov told Sputnik Kyrgyzstan. Earlier it became known that the Kyrgyz arrived on the same board with the citizens of Armenia, Belarus and Kazakhstan. "All of them are healthy, there is no temperature. Currently they are being examined. But they must go through quarantine - presumably, 14 days, and then it will be seen. They also agree. All the necessary conditions have been created for them. Most of them are students," the deputy minister said. According to the press service of the Ministry of Health, Kyrgyz citizens arriving from Wuhan will be kept in a specially designated infectious diseases department of a hospital outside Bishkek.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: Starting on Mar 15, the authorities of Kyrgyzstan have advised limiting trips with children to entertainment centers. The Republican headquarters urge citizens not to visit shopping and entertainment centers. A quarantine for schoolchildren and students has been announced in Kyrgyzstan for three weeks. The authorities urge citizens not to visit shopping and entertainment centers with their children, not to take them to playgrounds. It is recommended to stay at home during the quarantine period. Entrepreneurs working in the field of trade, services, and public catering are advised to refrain from holding and participating in public events until the time limit is lifted, and also to install sanitizers, air purifiers in rooms and halls, providing employees and visitors with disinfectants.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: Kyrgyzstanis coming from abroad were divided into two categories due to the threat of coronavirus. According to this algorithm, all citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic arriving from countries where cases of coronavirus infection have been registered will be divided into two categories. The list of countries can be changed in accordance with the development of the epidemiological situation in the world. The first category includes the following countries: China, Italy, Iran, Spain, Republic of Korea, Germany, France, USA, Switzerland, UK, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Sweden, Belgium, Denmark. This list comes into effect on March 19, 2020. Thus, Kyrgyzstanis arriving from the countries of the first category, including in transit, are subject to observation for 14 days in specially designated places. This category includes all citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic: holders of ID-cards, civil, service and diplomatic passports. The person who violated the conditions of observation is subject to prosecution in accordance with the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic. The second category includes all countries where the coronavirus has been detected. All citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic, arriving including in transit from countries of the second category, are subject to home quarantine for a period of 14 days. Important: people who have visited, including in transit, countries of t
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
Starting on Mar 26, several streets of Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan) will be closed - quarantine zone map created. Not everyone will be allowed to enter quarantine zones. The quarantine zone is created in order to disinfect the city. Only certain people will be allowed into the zone. A quarantine zone has been created in Bishkek closer to the city center, Bishkek commandant Almaz Orozaliev said at a press conference. According to him, the zone is limited to 7 April, Akhunbaev, Bakaeva streets, Molodaya Gvardii, Zhibek Zholu, Saliev and Osmonkul avenues. "A ban will be introduced for pedestrians and cars, because disinfection is being carried out in the zone. Only civil servants,doctors, law enforcement officers, the banking system and representatives of companies providing the city with food and medicine will be allowed in," he said.
The previously closed territory of the central part of the city will also be closed for further disinfection. From April 2, the territory of the quarantine zone of Bishkek will expand to the south, the capital's commandant's office reports. The added part of the territory will be closed for the passage of citizens and the passage of motor vehicles from: Zhukeyev-Pudovkin along Akhunbaev street to Bakaev; Suerkulova - Zhukeyev-Pudovkin to the highway; Baitik Baatyr in the north direction from Masaliev street; U-turn to Maldybaeva along Masaliev street; Maldybaeva in the north direction from Masaliev street; Toktonaliev in the north direction from Masaliev

Starting on Mar 26, several streets of Bishkek (Kyrgyzstan) will be closed - quarantine zone map created. Not everyone will be allowed to enter quarantine zones. The quarantine zone is created in order to disinfect the city. Only certain people will be allowed into the zone. A quarantine zone has been created in Bishkek closer to the city center, Bishkek commandant Almaz Orozaliev said at a press conference. According to him, the zone is limited to 7 April, Akhunbaev, Bakaeva streets, Molodaya Gvardii, Zhibek Zholu, Saliev and Osmonkul avenues. "A ban will be introduced for pedestrians and cars, because disinfection is being carried out in the zone. Only civil servants, doctors, law enforcement officers, the banking system and representatives of companies providing the city with food and medicine will be allowed in," he said.
On April 5, The quarantine zone in Bishkek has been expanded, said the commandant of the capital, Almazbek Orozaliev. According to him, the zone has been expanded in the following directions: to the south - along Tokombayev Street (South Highway); to the north - to BCHK; to the east - to Cholpon-Atinskaya street; to the west - to Sadyrbaev Street (formerly Bach).

description: Starting on May 4, a ban is introduced on the departure and entry of residents from the Issyk-Kul region (Kyrgyzstan). Entry to the region will be possible if there is a certificate of negative results of an express test or PCR analysis for coronavirus. Today, the operational headquarters of the Issyk-Kul region decided to impose a ban on the departure of residents from the region, the Republican headquarters for combating coronavirus reported. The restriction will take effect on May 4. Entry to the area will be possible if there is a certificate of negative results of an express test or PCR analysis for coronavirus. Persons arriving from other regions will be sent to 14-day home quarantine.

description: On Mar 19, 2020, baths, saunas and swimming pools are being closed in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. A government decree in Kyrgyzstan limits the operation of facilities where mass events are held. Due to the situation with the spread of coronavirus, many public institutions, including saunas and public baths, are being closed in Bishkek, the press service of the mayor's office said.

description: On Mar 20, 2020, all boarding houses in Issyk-Kul, Kyrgyzstan will be quarantined. According to the latest data, six cases of COVID-19 infection have been identified in Kyrgyzstan. An emergency regime has been introduced in two districts. All boarding houses and guest houses in the Issyk-Kul region will be quarantined. This decision was made at today's meeting of the regional headquarters to counter the spread of coronavirus infection. "We must follow the recommendations of the Ministry of Health to minimize the risks of infection in the region. This is a temporary need," said Akylbek Osmonaliev, the plenipotentiary representative of the government in the region.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is closed/locked down

description: On March 20, 2020, food, clothing, livestock, and car markets will temporarily not function in the Batken region, Kyrgyzstan. The plenipotentiary representative of the government in the Batken region, Alisher Abdrakhmanov, ordered to close markets in the region, the press service of the embassy reported. The central market of Batken, markets in the villages of Samarkandek (on the border with Tajikistan), Kara-Bak, Halmion and other large bazaars were closed. The decision was made in order to ensure safety due to the situation with the coronavirus. Clothing, food, livestock and car markets were closed down.

description: On Mar 11 2020, due to the coronavirus in Kyrgyzstan, the period for issuing a passport will be reduced. Acceptance of documents is carried out in any territorial subdivisions of the SRS or in public service centers, regardless of the place of residence. The term for the production and issuance of general civil passports in Kyrgyzstan will be shortened for some time from 18 to 12 working days, the press service of the State Registration Service reported. The reason is the ban on crossing the border with an ID card introduced from March 1 in order to prevent the coronavirus COVID-19 in the country. "If, when issuing a passport in the usual manner, citizens received it after 18 working days, now they will be able to receive it six days earlier. No additional payment will be charged," the message says. It was noted that the State Center for Personification is now working in an enhanced mode in two shifts - night and day. The department recalls that the acceptance of documents for the registration and production of a general civil passport is carried out in any territorial subdivisions of the State Registration Service or in public service centers (PSC), regardless of the place of residence. Citizens temporarily outside the republic can apply for a passport to diplomatic institutions. For the convenience of citizens, three mini-public service centers were opened in Bishkek, which work on weekends.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Issuing of permits/certificates and/or processing of government documents
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with no conditions attached

description: Starting on 19 Mar, 2020, on-site registration of marriages in Kyrgyzstan is temporarily canceled. This service is now temporarily unavailable. On-site registration of marriages is temporarily canceled in Kyrgyzstan due to the situation with coronavirus, the press service of the State Registration Service said. This service involves the departure of the registry office employee to the place of registration (to a restaurant or to your home) for a fee. According to a government decree, this service is temporarily unavailable. The SRS noted that five couples have already refused field registration.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: On February 27th 2020, The republican headquarters to prevent the spread of coronavirus recommends to Kyrgyzstanis to avoid crowded places. (Kyrgyzstan) The press service of the government reports. The members of the headquarters urged citizens to believe only official reports, and not speculation spread on social networks. "In addition, the members of the headquarters recommended that citizens, as far as possible, avoid crowded places, limit events with the participation of a large number of people, strictly observe the rules of personal hygiene, and conduct explanatory work with children," the statement said.

On February 27, 2020, The Ice Hockey World Championship in Bishkek has been postponed due to coronavirus. The Ice Hockey World Championship in Division IV, which was to begin next week in Bishkek, has been postponed to May, the State Agency for Youth, Physical Culture and Sports reported. At an operational meeting led by the director of the state agency Kanat Amankulov, it was decided to postpone other major international sports events planned in Kyrgyzstan to a later date: an intergovernmental meeting on countering doping in sports in the Asian and Oceanian regions, scheduled for April 2020; Ice hockey world championship in the IV division, scheduled for March 3-5. In addition, the Asian licensed wrestling tournament, which was supposed to be held on March 27-29 in the capital of Kyrgyzstan, is canceled. This decision is associated with the aggravation of the situation with the spread of coronavirus in the world.
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of a recreational or commercial event

description: On March 5, "a court in Kyrgyzstan...banned mass rallies in the centre of the capital until July."
March 4: "The national office for prevention of coronavirus of Kyrgyzstan recommends citizens to stop holding of mass events and avoid the crowded places."
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Kyrgyzstan on March 6, canceled "all the theatrical performances and concerts."
In Kyrgyzstan "All cultural and sports events with participation of more than 100 people are canceled in Bishkek," as of March 11.
Kyrgyzstan "government officially introduced a temporary ban on holding mass cultural, sports and other events" as ruled on March 12.

Starting on Mar 12, 2020, the government has officially limited the holding of mass events in the Kyrgyz Republic. According to the order, government agencies must carry out certain procedures. There are recommendations for those who work in the areas of trade, catering and services. The government of Kyrgyzstan has officially introduced a temporary restriction on holding mass events until the epidemiological situation in the world improves, the press service of the head of state said. The corresponding order was signed by Prime Minister Mukhammedkaly Abylgaziev. The decision was made in order to prevent the coronavirus COVID-19 and ensure the sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population. Individuals and legal entities who work in the areas of trade, services and catering are advised to refrain from holding and participating in public events until the time limit is lifted, as well as to install sanitizers and indoor air purifiers, and provide employees and visitors with disinfectants. Ministries, state committees, administrative departments, plenipotentiaries of the government in the regions, state administrations and local governments were instructed to take measures to provide institutions providing state and municipal services to the population with disinfectants, as well as to carry out explanatory work.

On March 9 2020, it was announced that in Kyrgyzstan, events at Nooruz were canceled due to the threat of coronavirus. All cultural events that were planned for the near future were canceled throughout the country. Festive events on the occasion of Nooruz, the Day of the Spring Equinox, have been canceled in Kyrgyzstan, the press service of the government told Sputnik Kyrgyzstan. On March 21, there will be no traditional walks around the country and concert programs. This is due to measures to prevent coronavirus in the country. The traditional equestrian games at Nooruz have also been canceled.
Earlier, the government said that mass cultural events planned for the near future had been canceled throughout Kyrgyzstan. This decision was made by the Republican Headquarters for the implementation of economic measures aimed at minimizing the consequences of external shocks, including in connection with the spread of coronavirus, on the recommendation of the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic.
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of an annually recurring event
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

The traditional equestrian games at Nooruz have also been canceled.
Earlier, the government said that mass cultural events planned for the near future had been canceled throughout Kyrgyzstan. This decision was made by the Republican Headquarters for the implementation of economic measures aimed at minimizing the consequences of external shocks, including in connection with the spread of coronavirus, on the recommendation of the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On April 23 in Kyrgyzstan the holding of mass iftars in "in mosques, in cafes and at homes" will not be possible this year.
Kyrgyzstan announced on April 30 "that school celebrations such as the Farewell Bell, school reunions and graduation parties will be canceled this year."
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of an annually recurring event
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 30, Kyrgyzstan urged people to self-isolate and to go out of their homes as little as possible.
